intro: Cladocolea tehuacanensis, commonly known as the Tehuacan flax, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, showcasing features such as reduced leaf surface area to minimize water loss. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, which aid in its propagation in dry, rocky habitats. Cladocolea tehuacanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological traits and ecological adaptations.
